item.title: French Nicotine Pouch Ban Even Prohibits Personal Possession
item.description: France will enforce a total ban on nicotine pouches starting in March 2026, following a decree from the health ministry. Despite objections from other EU countries, the government argues the measure is needed to protect public health, especially young people, as nicotine is deemed a health hazard. (Published on September 29, 2025byvaping360.com)

item.title: Vaping During Pregnancy Could Be Associated With Increased Risk of Adverse Events
item.description: Vaping during pregnancy poses risks such as preterm birth, low birth weight, and fetal growth issues. A study suggests complete nicotine cessation for pregnant individuals due to harmful substances in e-cigarettes. Up to 7% of women vape during pregnancy, increasing concerns despite some considering it safer than smoking. Research shows a 40% higher risk of preterm birth, 49% risk of low birth weight, and 32% risk of small-for-gestational-age babies with vaping. The study reviewed data from 9 studies involving 423,680 pregnant women. Advocates stress the need to educate on risks, support quitting, and regulate vaping marketing to protect maternal and fetal health. (Published on September 29, 2025bydrugtopics.com)
